---
title: 'Terms of Service'
description: 'NOMOS Terms of Service - Legal terms and conditions for using NOMOS'
---

**Last updated: July 2, 2025**

These Terms of Service ("Terms") govern your use of the NOMOS framework and related services provided by dowhile.dev ("we", "our", or "us"). By using NOMOS, you agree to these Terms.

## Acceptance of Terms

<Info>
By downloading, installing, or using NOMOS, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you disagree with any part of these Terms, you may not use our services.
</Info>

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Eligibility">
    You must be at least 18 years old to use NOMOS for commercial purposes. If you're under 18, you may use NOMOS for educational purposes with parental consent.
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Entity Acceptance">
    If you're using NOMOS on behalf of an organization, you represent that you have authority to bind that organization to these Terms.
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Geographic Restrictions">
    NOMOS is available worldwide, but certain features may be restricted in some jurisdictions due to local laws or regulations.
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## License and Use Rights

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Open Source License">
    ### NOMOS Framework

    The NOMOS framework is licensed under the **MIT License**:

    ```
    MIT License

    Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
    of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
    in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
    to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
    copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
    furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

    The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
    copies or substantial portions of the Software.
    ```

    **What this means:**
    - ✅ Commercial use allowed
    - ✅ Modification allowed
    - ✅ Distribution allowed
    - ✅ Private use allowed
    - ✅ Patent use allowed
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Web Services">
    ### Playground and Web Tools

    Our web-based services are provided under these Terms:

    **Permitted Uses:**
    - Create and test agents for personal or commercial use
    - Export configurations for use with the open source framework
    - Share projects in accordance with our community guidelines

    **Restrictions:**
    - No automated scraping or bulk data collection
    - No attempt to reverse engineer our services
    - No use for illegal or harmful purposes
    - No circumvention of usage limits or security measures
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Documentation and Content">
    ### Documentation License

    Our documentation is licensed under **Creative Commons Attribution 4.0**:
    - ✅ Share and adapt the material
    - ✅ Use for any purpose, including commercial
    - ⚠️ Must provide attribution to dowhile.dev
    - ⚠️ Must indicate if changes were made
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Acceptable Use Policy

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Permitted Uses">
    You may use NOMOS to:
    - Build AI agents for legitimate business or personal purposes
    - Develop commercial applications and services
    - Create educational content and tutorials
    - Contribute to the open source project
    - Integrate with other software and services
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Prohibited Uses">
    You may not use NOMOS to:
    - Create content that violates laws or regulations
    - Develop applications for illegal activities
    - Generate spam, malware, or harmful content
    - Impersonate individuals or organizations
    - Violate intellectual property rights
    - Harass, abuse, or harm others
    - Collect personal data without consent
    - Circumvent security measures or rate limits
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Content Guidelines">
    When using NOMOS and sharing content:
    - Respect others' privacy and intellectual property
    - Follow community guidelines and codes of conduct
    - Report violations to our moderation team
    - Maintain professional and respectful communication
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## Third-Party Services

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="LLM Providers">
    ### Integration Responsibility

    NOMOS integrates with third-party LLM providers. Your use of these services is subject to their terms:

    - [OpenAI Terms of Use](https://openai.com/terms/)
    - [Anthropic Terms of Service](https://www.anthropic.com/terms)
    - [Google AI Terms of Service](https://policies.google.com/terms)
    - [Mistral AI Terms of Service](https://mistral.ai/terms/)

    **Your Responsibilities:**
    - Comply with each provider's terms and usage policies
    - Manage your own API keys and billing
    - Ensure appropriate content filtering and safety measures
    - Respect rate limits and usage restrictions
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Data Processing">
    ### Third-Party Data Handling

    When you use LLM providers through NOMOS:
    - Your data is sent directly to the provider you choose
    - We do not intercept, store, or process this data
    - You are responsible for data privacy and compliance
    - Provider-specific privacy policies apply

    ### Local Processing

    When using local models (Ollama):
    - No external data transmission occurs
    - You maintain complete control over your data
    - Standard open source software terms apply
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="External Integrations">
    ### APIs and Services

    NOMOS may integrate with various external services:
    - Database providers (PostgreSQL, Redis, etc.)
    - Cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)
    - Development tools (GitHub, Docker, etc.)

    Each integration is subject to the respective provider's terms.
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Privacy and Data Protection

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Data Collection">
    Our data practices are detailed in our [Privacy Policy](/privacy-policy). Key points:
    - The open source framework collects no personal data
    - Web services may collect usage analytics
    - You control all agent data and configurations
    - Third-party integrations have separate privacy policies
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Data Security">
    We implement reasonable security measures to protect your information:
    - Encryption in transit and at rest
    - Regular security audits and updates
    - Minimal data collection and retention
    - Transparent security practices
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Data Rights">
    You have rights regarding your data:
    - Access and portability of your information
    - Correction of inaccurate data
    - Deletion of personal information
    - Control over data processing and sharing
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## Intellectual Property

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Our Rights">
    ### dowhile.dev Intellectual Property

    We retain rights to:
    - The NOMOS trademark and branding
    - Our proprietary web services and playground
    - Documentation and marketing materials
    - Innovations and improvements we develop

    **Note:** The open source framework remains under MIT license.
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Your Rights">
    ### Your Intellectual Property

    You retain ownership of:
    - Agent configurations and prompts you create
    - Custom tools and integrations you develop
    - Applications and services you build with NOMOS
    - Content and data you process through agents

    **MIT License Grant:** By contributing to the open source project, you grant us rights to include your contributions under the MIT license.
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Respect for Others">
    ### Third-Party Rights

    When using NOMOS:
    - Respect copyrights, trademarks, and patents
    - Don't use NOMOS to infringe others' IP rights
    - Obtain proper licenses for content you process
    - Follow fair use guidelines and attribution requirements
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Service Availability

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Uptime and Reliability">
    **Open Source Framework:**
    - Available 24/7 (runs on your infrastructure)
    - No service dependencies or downtime
    - Your responsibility to maintain and update

    **Web Services:**
    - Best effort uptime (no SLA for free services)
    - Scheduled maintenance with advance notice
    - Emergency maintenance as needed
    - Status updates at status.dowhile.dev
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Service Changes">
    We may modify or discontinue services:
    - 30 days notice for significant changes
    - Immediate action for security or legal issues
    - Migration tools and data export options when possible
    - Open source framework remains available regardless
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Support">
    Support is provided on a best-effort basis:
    - Community support via Discord and GitHub
    - Documentation and self-service resources
    - Enterprise support available separately
    - No guaranteed response times for free services
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## Financial Terms

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Free Services">
    ### Open Source and Basic Services

    **Free Forever:**
    - NOMOS open source framework
    - Basic documentation and community support
    - Community Discord and GitHub access
    - Basic playground features

    **Usage Limits:**
    - Rate limits on web services to prevent abuse
    - Storage limits for free playground accounts
    - Bandwidth limits for documentation and resources
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Third-Party Costs">
    ### Your Responsibility

    You are responsible for:
    - LLM provider API costs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.)
    - Cloud infrastructure costs (if you deploy to cloud)
    - Third-party service fees (databases, monitoring, etc.)
    - Domain and hosting costs for your applications
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Future Premium Services">
    ### Potential Paid Features

    We may introduce premium services in the future:
    - Advanced playground features
    - Enhanced support and SLA guarantees
    - Enterprise deployment tools
    - Custom integrations and development

    **Grandfathering:** Current free users will retain access to existing free features.
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Disclaimers and Limitations

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="As-Is Provision">
    NOMOS is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind:
    - No guarantee of fitness for particular purpose
    - No warranty of merchantability or quality
    - No assurance of uninterrupted or error-free operation
    - Use at your own risk and discretion
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="AI-Generated Content">
    **Important Disclaimers:**
    - AI-generated content may be inaccurate or biased
    - Outputs should be reviewed and verified
    - We're not responsible for AI model decisions or outputs
    - Compliance with AI safety guidelines is your responsibility
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Third-Party Services">
    We disclaim responsibility for:
    - Third-party service availability or performance
    - LLM provider policies, pricing, or capabilities
    - External API changes or deprecations
    - Data processing by third-party services
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## Limitation of Liability

<Warning>
**Important Legal Notice:** To the maximum extent permitted by law, dowhile.dev shall not be liable for any damages arising from your use of NOMOS.
</Warning>

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Excluded Damages">
    ### Types of Damages Not Covered

    We shall not be liable for:
    - Indirect, incidental, or consequential damages
    - Loss of profits, revenue, or business opportunities
    - Data loss or corruption (backup your data!)
    - Service interruptions or downtime
    - Third-party actions or services
    - AI-generated content issues
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Damage Caps">
    ### Maximum Liability

    In jurisdictions where liability cannot be excluded:
    - Total liability limited to $100 USD
    - Applies to all claims and causes of action
    - Limitation applies regardless of legal theory
    - Some jurisdictions may not allow these limitations
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Your Responsibilities">
    ### Risk Management

    You are responsible for:
    - Testing NOMOS in non-production environments
    - Implementing appropriate backup and recovery procedures
    - Monitoring and validating AI-generated outputs
    - Complying with applicable laws and regulations
    - Maintaining security of your systems and data
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Indemnification

You agree to indemnify and hold harmless dowhile.dev from claims arising from:

<Steps>
  <Step title="Your Use of NOMOS">
    Including violations of these Terms or applicable laws
  </Step>
  <Step title="Your Content">
    Including content you process through or create with NOMOS
  </Step>
  <Step title="Third-Party Claims">
    Including IP infringement or privacy violations
  </Step>
  <Step title="Breach of Terms">
    Including violations of acceptable use policies
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Termination

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Termination by You">
    You may stop using NOMOS at any time:
    - No need to notify us for open source framework
    - Delete your account for web services
    - Export your data before termination
    - Certain provisions survive termination
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Termination by Us">
    We may terminate or suspend access for:
    - Violation of these Terms or acceptable use policies
    - Illegal or harmful activities
    - Non-payment of enterprise services
    - Extended periods of inactivity
    - Legal or regulatory requirements
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Effect of Termination">
    Upon termination:
    - Your right to use web services ends immediately
    - Open source framework license continues under MIT terms
    - Data export tools available for reasonable period
    - Outstanding obligations remain in effect
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## Governing Law and Disputes

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Governing Law">
    These Terms are governed by the laws of:
    - **State**: [To be specified]
    - **Country**: United States
    - **Jurisdiction**: Federal and state courts in [Location]

    International users agree to submit to this jurisdiction for disputes.
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Dispute Resolution">
    ### Preferred Resolution Process

    <Steps>
      <Step title="Direct Communication">
        Contact us at legal@dowhile.dev to discuss the issue
      </Step>
      <Step title="Good Faith Negotiation">
        Attempt to resolve disputes through discussion
      </Step>
      <Step title="Mediation">
        Use professional mediation if negotiation fails
      </Step>
      <Step title="Litigation">
        Court proceedings as last resort
      </Step>
    </Steps>
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Class Action Waiver">
    You agree to resolve disputes individually, not as part of class actions or collective proceedings, except where prohibited by law.
  </Tab>
</Tabs>

## Modifications to Terms

<AccordionGroup>
  <Accordion title="Change Process">
    We may update these Terms periodically:
    - Significant changes announced with 30 days notice
    - Minor changes effective immediately
    - Notice provided via email or prominent website display
    - Continued use constitutes acceptance
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Version Control">
    - Terms include "last updated" date
    - Previous versions available upon request
    - Material changes highlighted in update notices
    - Archive of historical terms maintained
  </Accordion>

  <Accordion title="Objection Rights">
    If you disagree with changes:
    - Stop using affected services before effective date
    - Export your data before termination
    - Previous terms continue to apply to past use
    - Open source license remains MIT regardless
  </Accordion>
</AccordionGroup>

## General Provisions

<Tabs>
  <Tab title="Severability">
    If any provision of these Terms is found invalid or unenforceable:
    - Only that provision is affected
    - Remaining terms continue in full force
    - Invalid provisions replaced with similar enforceable terms
    - Overall agreement remains effective
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Assignment">
    - You may not assign these Terms without our consent
    - We may assign our rights and obligations freely
    - Terms bind successors and permitted assigns
    - Assignment includes corporate mergers and acquisitions
  </Tab>

  <Tab title="Waiver">
    - Failure to enforce provisions doesn't waive future enforcement
    - Waivers must be in writing to be effective
    - No waiver of one breach waives future breaches
    - Course of dealing doesn't modify written terms
  </Tab>
</Tabs>
